original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Engert Street
text:
(1) Arthur Kill Road, south side, west of Engert Street. The house belonged to Lydia Winant in 1898, and to Mary L. Dissosway from 1907 to 1917. Dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear. September 19, 1925

P.L.Sperr

(2) The same, at a later date, looking east. April 30, 1929

P.L.Sperr

(3) The same as view 2. May 5, 1937

P.L.Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Engert Street
text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, north side, about 150 feet west of Engert Street, showing O'Neill's Family Resort. The real estate maps from 1898 to 1917 show it to have been known as the Rossville Hotel. The Rossville Post Office was located here in 1874 (Beers's map).

P. L. Sperr

(2)
A rear view of the house from the Arthur Kill shore.

September 19, 1925

P. L. Sperr

(3)
A front view at a later date.

P. L. Sperr

October 6, 1928

original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Engert Street
text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, at Engert Street, showing the Rossville Hook and Ladder Company of the New York City Fire Department.

April 22, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.
